intro: Rupestrina, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their woody stems and showy, often fragrant flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, red, and white. Rupestrina species are typically found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and drought tolerance. The genus includes several species, some of which are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia.
